conversations.content: Squeak! Squeeeeak!
The decorations are looking great. Well done, you two.
Squeak, squeak!
Oh, absolutely. This Dragonyule tree is stunning.
We didn't celebrate Ilian festivals in our homeland, so this is all quite new.
...It would have been nice, though, to have a day set aside to spend with loved ones.
Squeak!
Hm? Of course you count as loved ones. Don't you worry.
Yes... If nothing else, I should be thankful for the chance to celebrate the occasion with you both.
Thank you for helping with the decorations, you three.
Putting up such a large tree can't have been easy.
Oh, it was no trouble. These two actually quite enjoyed the process.
But if I might ask: why are you dressed like that?
His Highness asked me to deliver presents as Saint Starfall.
I shall be visiting the towns and villages nearby, so I thought it wise to try the outfit on before I left.
Ah, yes. The patron saint of Dragonyule.
His sleigh is driven by reindeer, right?
Squeeeeeak!
What's that? You two want to dress up for Dragonyule as well?
I'm sorry, but I don't think they make outfits in your size.
Oh, I'm sure I can whip up something. Consider it a Dragonyule present.
Would you like one as well? You would make quite the dashing trio.
Er, well... I suppose it couldn't hurt.
Splendid. Saint Starfall and reindeer, then?
That would be wonderful. Thank you, Cleo.
It was really great of you to make outfits for all three of them. I can't wait to see how they look!
They should be finished changing soon... Ah, here they are.
Squeak! Squeak squeak!
Goodness, they are adorable!
Heh. Two little Saint Starfalls, huh? I love it.
Sure, but what about the reindeer? I was promised reindeer.
Look no further!
Many thanks for this exceptional outfit, Cleo!
Hold on, YER the reindeer? Thought for sure it'd be the little guys.
Nonsense. Saint Starfall is the star of Dragonyule, so it's only right for Fydon and Felyx to fill the role.
Besides, Saint Starfall needs a strong reindeer to pull his sleigh, right?
Surely there's no one better suited to the task!
I dunno man, I'm pretty sure this is just another ＂Dragon Daddy＂ thing.
Squeak, squeak!
Heh. You two look terrific!  Mmmf!
...The hell was that?
It was meant to be a reindeer noise, but I guess I need more practice.
...Right...
Make sure to thank Cleo for your outfits, you two.
Squeak! Squeak!
Heh. You are more than welcome.
So, do you three want to help deliver presents too?
Squeeeeeak!
Would that be all right? They seem quite excited at the prospect.
I would be happy to share some of the presents I was set to deliver—
Cease this nonsense at once! Dragons should NOT play at being Saint Starfall!
Was that...?
Bestowing presents to people is the job of people alone!
Child of Miracles Amane
What's wrong with a dragon being Saint Starfall?
It is too dangerous, obviously!
...I tried to give you a chance, Amane, but I won't let you affront dragon kind in my presence.
Whoa there, you two! Easy!
What's gotten into you, Amane?
Squeak?
I-I just...
Just... Stop this madness, all right?!
Jeez, what's HER deal?
I had thought her distaste for dragons long behind her...
Yeah, it seems like a while since she flew off the handle like that.
...Are you all right, Xainfried?
Yes, I'm fine.
I must remember she lost her family and home to dragons. She has her reasons for acting the way she does.
Do you still wish to deliver presents?
If so, you will need to leave shortly.
Hmm...
Squeeeeak...
...All right. We'll go.
Are you sure?
Some people may be scared of Fydon and Felyx, or refuse gifts from them.
But I'll be there to speak on their behalf.
After all, if I baby them forever, they'll never grow.
Squeak! Squeak!
Very well. Then I wish you safe travels.
Perhaps I was a bit too harsh... Hm? What's that?
Th-they're still going?!
Cleo! Why didn't you stop them?!
Calm yourself, Amane. They won't hurt anyone.
I know that—it's not the safety of the villagers I'm worried about!
Now, let's dash away! *whinny*
Squeak squeeeeeak!
All right, let's get started! *whinny* Are you two ready?
Squeeeak...
What's wrong? You're not shy, are you?
Don't worry. I'll be right here with you, every step of the way. I won't let anything bad happen.
Squeak?
Heh, okay. Let me show you how it's done.
Merry Dragonyule! We come bearing gifts from Saint Starfall!
*gasp* Saint Starfall?!
Yaaay! Preseeents!
All right, everyone, line up and wait your turn.
Yes, Mr. Reindeer!
Here you are. Merry Dragonyule!
Thanks!
Now you try.
Squeak... Squeak squeak!
Awww, they're adorable! I've never seen a dragon Saint Starfall before.
Well I'll be darned. Dragons delivering presents, just like in Ilia's day! Thank you kindly.
Thank you, Saint Starfall!
Well now. That went quite well, wouldn't you say?
Squeak! Squeak!
Are you dressed as a reindeer, young man?
That's right.
Ha ha, marvelous! And how lucky to be towing such sweet little Saint Starfalls.
We're very fortunate to be visited by such kind and devoted dragons. Thank you.
We're just happy to be of service—though I admit it warms my heart to hear you praise them.
More than even being praised myself...
My, what a loving father!
Hah, yes, well. ...Hm?
Squeak, squeak!
Huh? Are you giving me a present?
Squeak!
Thanks, but...I don't deserve it.
Why do you say that?
Saint Starfall only gives presents to good children.
Is that so?
Yeah, he—wait, how do you not know that?
Er, I was simply testing your knowledge! *whinny*
So, you think you've been bad, then?
So bad you don't deserve presents?
Yeah... I had a big fight with my dad.
I said some really nasty stuff I didn't even mean, and...
Squeak!
Are you even listening? I don't deserve any presents!
＂Based on what we just heard, you very much do.＂ ...says Saint Starfall.
What...?
You said some unpleasant things to your father, which you know was bad.
Yeah...
But you see, the fact that you're aware of that means you're a good person at heart.
...It does?
Very much so.
So you should feel no shame accepting these presents.
O-okay, but why are you giving me two?
One is for you, and the other is for your father. You should give it to him and make things right.
Squeak! Squeak!
Okay! I'll give him this and apologize, right now!
I guess there really ARE good dragons!
...What did he mean by that?
That boy didn't say anything unpleasant to you, did he?
Oh, thank goodness our little Saint Starfalls are safe!
We talked for a while, but he was nothing but kind. Why?
You see, the boy's father doesn't think very highly of dragons.
I heard he's been raising his son to feel the same, which is simply awful.
I see...
His father goes beyond ＂disliking＂ dragons, I'm afraid. I've heard some terrible things leave his lips in town.
He seems to think they ＂all need to be wiped out.＂ Can you believe that?!
Oh, it gets worse. Apparently they both belong to the dragon-killing Syrol tribe.
Wh-what did you just say?!
The Syrol tribe, dear.
No...
Are you all right, lad? You've gone deathly pale.
(I know that name all too well...)
(Those monsters murdered my tribe— along with Felyx and Fydon's parents.)
*pant* *pant* We're not being followed, are we?
Squeak!
I won't let anyone hurt you!
(I know that name all too well... Those monsters murdered my tribe—along with Felyx and Fydon's parents.)
Are you sure you're all right?
Y-yes. But I'm afraid we must be going.
More stops to make, eh? Take care!
Thank you! Have a merry Dragonyule!
(I need to get these two back to the castle, fast!)
(Please let our journey home be safe. Please!)
Squeak! Squeak!
Huh?!
So someone was following us after all... Hah!
Dammit... My son said those dragons just had a reindeer with them, not some guardian!
What's that look for? We ain't here for you.
Just give us the dragons, and you're free to go.
Never.
You know that means we gotta kill you, right?
Do your worst, you barbarians!
As an Aegis, I won't let any harm befall them!
Aegis...? Why's that sound familiar...
You won't have your way this time! I'll make you pay for the lives you stole!
Oooh, I remember now! You're one'a them savages that shelter dragons in the mountains!
I thought we slaughtered 'em all, but I guess we can finish that now!
You monsters!
Urgh... He's no pushover. If you see an opening to kill those dragons, take it!
Got it!
Why are you so intent on exterminating dragons?! What could they have possibly done to deserve that?!
My tribe was peaceful... Why did they have to die?! And what of these dragons' parents?!
TELL ME! HAAAAAH!
Whoa!
Squeak, squeak!
Stay close, you two. I won't let them get you!
Peaceful? Hah! Dragons took EVERYTHING from us—why should they be protected?!
What are you talking about?
Pfft. You know that dragon your tribe was protecting?
It destroyed our village!
What?!
I'll never forget it. One moment we're livin' in peace, and then suddenly this huge storm blows in and crushes all the houses—along with everyone inside 'em.
I looked up to the sky and saw a dragon, way up above the clouds. Didn't take me long to put two and two together!
I told some people in neighboring villages, but you know what they said? That we were ＂unlucky＂ for bein' in a dragon's path!
You asked me what dragons ever did to us. Well, what did WE ever do to THEM?!
My people just wanted to live in peace, and now they're dead!
I didn't know... This is the first I've ever heard of that! And that's why you decided to take revenge on us?
That's right. When someone hurts you, you gotta make them feel just as bad. Or worse!
We joined up with a nation that shared our ideals. It's like paradise.
In what way?
They're all about ridding the world of dragons! So now we fight with them.
Wait... You don't mean...
So Amane is from a country bent on exterminating dragons?
That's right. Her village was destroyed by one, and she was the sole survivor.
That she alone prevailed, despite her youth, earned her the title ＂Child of Miracles.＂
Does the country you speak of support someone called the Child of Miracles?
Heh. You did your homework huh? It sure does.
But she doesn't actually do any fighting herself. That's...OUR JOB!
Urgh!
And anyone who gets in our way has a shallow grave waiting!
Ngh!
*pant* *pant*
Squeeeak...
Come on! Are you gonna dance, or are we gonna finish this?
(All this time, I thought our village fell victim to senseless violence...)
(And thinking about people attacking dragons merely for being dragons filled me with endless anger...)
(But if what they're saying is true...)
(Then the injustice in their eyes is—)
Gotcha! HAH!
No—
AAARGH!
SQUEAK!
Heh. No one ever tell you not to daydream in battle?
Squeak... Squeak...
With a wound like that, you're done fightin'! Now die, dragons!
No!
Now die, dragons!
NO! DON'T!
Gah!
Damn you!
Raaaagh!
Urgh!
I won't let you harm these two!
Stay behind me!
Squeak!
(I can't afford to hesitate. I am an Aegis—and their father.)
(My only concern should be their safety.)
Squeak! Squeak!
Wh-what are you doing?! Get behind me, please!
Squeak!
You're...protecting them?
Why the hell...?
Squeak, squeak!
Huh? Medicinal herbs and bandages?
We don't take charity from dragons!
Squeak!
Fydon! Felyx! Damn you...
Squeak! Squeak!
Squeak! Squeak!
Keep your trash!
Squeak! Squeeeak...
Wh-what's up with them? Why won't they just give up?
We're here to kill you! You won't change our minds!
What has gotten into you two?!
Squeak! Squeak squeak squeak SQUEAK!
What? It's because you're Saint Starfall?
Saint what now?
Saint Starfall—the saint who delivered presents on Dragonyule.
A pity play, huh? Spare me.
It isn't pity. They're doing this because today is Dragonyule.
What the hell does that matter?
Dragonyule is a day to spend with those you care for.
They just want to make sure you can do that.
So even if you were responsible for the death of their parents, they want to help you.
Shut up. SHUT UP!
I don't wanna hear about my loved ones from the same kinda monster that stole 'em from me!
Squeak!
Why didn't you move?!
I understand your feelings. I would feel them too, in your position.
But someone has to break this cycle of revenge.
If we don't, it will only end up engulfing our children.
I'm not suggesting you put your anger aside forever. If it were that easy, the world would be a much brighter place.
But just for today, can't you accept their kindness? Surely we can let our souls rest for one day.
Squeeeak...
...Fine.
What?! But they're dragons!
We can barely stand, boy. If this gets us home in one piece, so be it.
Thank you!
Squeak squeak!
Something about these two...it reminds me of my son.
Maybe 'cause he's a kid too. Or maybe it's their outfits.
What do you mean?
He came to me the other day sayin' he wanted to celebrate Dragonyule.
I don't know where he heard about it, but I told him there's no way we'd celebrate anything with ＂dragon＂ in the name.
It became a pretty big argument.
Then...
I had a big fight with my dad.
I said some really nasty stuff I didn't even mean, and...
You're that boy's father.
He told me he wanted to make amends with you.
That's why he accepted Fydon and Felyx's presents.
THAT'S where those came from?! *sigh* Kids are so innocent.
Accepting presents from the same creatures that murdered his mother...
Parents and children see completely different worlds, it seems...
Squeak...?
As a father myself, I can no longer fight you. I don't want to make your boy unhappy.
Hah! You were tryin' to kill us just a minute ago, and you think you can just call this thing off?
...Whatever. We'll let you off today.
Truly...?
I'm always gonna hate dragons. Nothing can change that.
And I don't get what all this ＂Dragonyule＂ stuff is about, either—but I know how important it is to spend time with the people you love.
I can't forget that I'm still a father.
Any objections?
...No. They helped us. I can't just cut them down now.
Will you keep hunting dragons?
We'll see. Either way, we're never gonna get on with people who protect them.
And yet... Maybe deep down, we want the same thing. Come on, let's go.
Yes, maybe so...
Squeak?
We both want to see our children smile.
Which means we have to consider what we as parents can do to provide a future where they can.
Xainfried! Are you all right?!
Ha HA! Make way for the true Saint Starfall has arrived!
What are you two doing here?
Amane and Cleo said you might be in danger.
We are glad to find you well. ...Hold. Are those undelivered presents I see?!
Very well. Your king shall lend you his aid! Leave the gifts in my benevolent hands, and tend to your wounds at the castle.
I appreciate your concern, but we'd prefer to keep delivering them ourselves.
My wounds won't slow me down—and I don't want to cut Fydon and Felyx's tenure as Saint Starfall short.
I understand. Will you at least let us help?
*sigh* I suppose all good kings must endure stubborn vassals. I shall indulge you this once!
With me, young Saint Starfalls! And you too, reindeer! Let us spread merriment to all!
Off we go! Haaaa ha ha ha!
Hold on, wait for us!
Heh. I'm sure we'll catch up.
Let's get these presents delivered, Saint Starfalls!
Squeak! Squeak!
In the end, Xainfried, Fydon, and Felyx got all of the presents delivered. Then, that night...
Ah, there you two are.
Squeak, squeak!
Taking in the yuletree, are you?
Squeak!
Heh. Yes, it really is a beautiful sight.
Squeak! *sniff* Squeak! Squeak!
Ah, forgive me—I nearly forgot I came to give you this.
You did excellent work as Saint Starfall, so I brought you some Dragonyule cake as reward for your efforts.
Squeak! *munch* *horf*
Slow down, you'll make yourselves sick! There's plenty where that came from, so take your time.
Squeak!
Well, I'm glad you're enjo— Hmm?
For a moment I thought someone was watching us. Did I imagine it?
Squeak? Squeak!
Wait, where are you go—
Aaah!
Er...Amane? Are you all right?
Rrgh! No, I am NOT all right, thank you very much! They just charged at me for no reason!
I'm sorry, I'm sure they didn't mean any harm.
I... D-don't worry about it. Now, if you'll excuse me!
Please, stay.
Huh?
You came to speak with us, right? You were just waiting for a good moment.
N-no, I was just...looking at that tree! That's all.
...Of course. Forgive me.
I-it's fine...
Umm...
Yes?
About this morning, I...
...Never mind.
Very well.
...Amane.
Aah! Don't startle me like that!
Sorry. I simply wished to share a word of thanks.
Thank you for worrying about us before. I'm sorry I didn't realize what you were doing sooner.
While we were out delivering presents, we were attacked by two members of the Syrol tribe.
That's what you were worried about, isn't it?
So you really did encounter them...
The Syrol tribe are my countrymen. They share our dream of expunging dragons from the world.
But recklessly hunting dragons puts both themselves and our country in danger— so I bade them remain within our borders.
Recently, however, I received word that they had slipped beyond them, and were heading this direction.
Which is why you didn't want us leaving the safety of the castle.
Yes. But I failed to convey that properly, and for that I am sorry.
I wanted to warn you, so Fydon and Felyx could stay safe.
Yes, I see that now.
Yeah... I really am sorry, Xainfried.
It's all right, Amane. Your fears were more than justified; that same tribe was responsible for murdering my own.
What?! Goodness... What happened when you met them, then?
We battled, for a time, and then went our separate ways.
Hold on—how did neither of you kill each other?!
It was all thanks to Fydon and Felyx.
Squeak?
Even while they were being attacked, they never lost sight of their mission as Saint Starfalls.
Fighting alone achieves nothing—and it especially doesn't make for a welcoming world.
Adults are quick to tell children to solve their disputes without violence, but what sort of example are we setting?
Wow... And the Syrols actually agreed? Amazing.
I'm glad you all made it through that. And while it may not be my place to say this...
Thank you for letting them live. They may be dangerous and unruly at times, but they are still my countrymen.
Of course. No one wants to lose those they care about.
Yes... I suppose you're right.
It can be easy to forget that. But to make a world our children can enjoy, we must practice forgiveness, not hate alone.
That's our duty as adults.
You're absolutely right.
So I swear this to you, Aegis: as the Child of Miracles, I will do all I can to aid your cause.
Are you sure? I would appreciate it, of course, but would your position allow it?
My goal is to stop dragons from causing humanity any more pain.
But if all that means is humanity inflicting more pain on itself, that doesn't solve anything.
Everyone wants a future their children can live easily in—a future free from sadness. So if we all share a common goal, why not work toward it together?
...I must admit, Amane, I'm quite taken aback hearing that from you.
But thank you. It's very reassuring to know I have your support.
It takes considerable courage to put past grudges aside. You truly are a child of miracles!
S-stop! No need to go overboard.
Oh! I almost forgot. I brought presents for Fydon and Felyx.
Squeak?!
I made some special dragon toys for them to play with.
Squeak, squeak!
Yes, that was very nice of her indeed! We should give her a present in return. ...Hm?
What's wrong?
We appear to be out of presents...
I'm so sorry! I assure you it's not because we think you're some sort of naughty child—
Child?! Do not treat me like some infant!
Were we not conversing as adults mere moments ago?!
Y-yes, we were indeed...
Besides, you have already given me the best present of all.
Oh? What's that?
Your safe return. That's all I ever wanted.
So thank you, Saint Starfalls!
...And thank you, Amane.
Squeak! Squeak!
(It can be hard to forsake hatred once it's taken root.)
(But I was given a chance to forgive those who wronged me, and to join forces with Amane.)
(Perhaps that is MY Dragonyule present.)
